newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finalnd's Merita Bank profit surges, sees dividend.
newsitem.headline: Finalnd's Merita Bank profit surges, sees dividend.

text.p: Finland's largest banking group Merita Oy Thursday reported a 93 percent jump in January-September earnings and said that shareholders would get a dividend for the first time in five years.

Operating profits after credit losses rose to 930 million Finnish markka ($204 million) from 482 million ($105 million). The result matched analysts' expectations and further confirmed that the Finnish banking sector was recovering from the deep crisis of the early 1990s.

Merita attributed the earnings growth to a significant decline in non-performing loans and credit losses, steady performance in its core banking business, increased commissions from securities trading and successful cost control.
The surge in profits meant that shareholders in Merita -- formed by the 1995 merger of banking groups Unitas and Kansallis-Osake-Pankki -- could expect a dividend for the first time in five years.
"It is our aim that the result for 1996 will permit us to resume payment of dividend," the bank said.
